content:
TITLE: Defining Human Disease Entry Format for UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the format used for each human disease entry in the controlled vocabulary. It includes line codes, content descriptions, and their occurrence in an entry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/uniprot-rest-api/blob/main/support-data-rest/src/test/resources/sample-humdisease.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
  ---------  ---------------------------     ------------------------------
  Line code  Content                         Occurrence in an entry
  ---------  ---------------------------     ------------------------------
  ID         Identifier                      Once; starts an entry
  AC         Accession (DI-xxxxx)            Once
  AR         Acronym                         Once
  DE         Definition                      Once or more
  SY         Alternative name(s)             Optional; once or more
  DR         Cross-reference(s)              Once or more
  KW         Associated keyword (accession)  Optional; Once or more
  //         Terminator                      Once; ends an entry
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Metabolic Pathway Classification System
DESCRIPTION: A structured hierarchical listing of metabolic pathways and their regulatory mechanisms. Each entry consists of a numerical identifier followed by the pathway name, with [regulation] suffix indicating regulatory components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/uniprot-rest-api/blob/main/uniprotkb-rest/src/test/resources/unipathway.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
441.821 Glycan metabolism; exopolysaccharide EPS I biosynthesis
441.821.R Glycan metabolism; exopolysaccharide EPS I biosynthesis [regulation]
441.631 Glycan metabolism; exopolysaccharide biosynthesis
441.631.R Glycan metabolism; exopolysaccharide biosynthesis [regulation]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Metabolic Pathway Hierarchy
DESCRIPTION: Hierarchical classification system for metabolic pathways including main categories and their sub-processes. Each pathway is assigned a unique numerical identifier, with regulatory pathways marked by '.R' suffix. Step-wise processes are indicated by numbered steps (e.g. step 1/3).
SOURCE: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/uniprot-rest-api/blob/main/common-rest/src/test/resources/unipathway.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
421.374 Phytoalexin biosynthesis; hydropinosylvin biosynthesis
421.374.R Phytoalexin biosynthesis; hydropinosylvin biosynthesis [regulation]
421.902 Phytoalexin biosynthesis; medicarpin biosynthesis
[...additional pathways omitted for brevity...]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disease Database Entry Format
DESCRIPTION: Standardized format for disease entries in UniProt database. Each entry contains fields like ID, AC (accession), AR (alternative reference), DE (description), SY (synonyms), DR (database references), and optional KW (keywords). Entries are separated by //
SOURCE: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/uniprot-rest-api/blob/main/support-data-rest/src/test/resources/sample-humdisease.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
ID   46,XY sex reversal 5.
AC   DI-02807
AR   SRXY5.
DE   A disorder of sex development. Affected individuals have a 46,XY
DE   karyotype but present as phenotypically normal females.
SY   46,XY gonadal dysgenesis complete CBX2-related.
SY   46,XY sex reversal CBX2-related.
SY   Disorder of sex development 46,XY CBX2-related.
SY   Sex reversal XY CBX2-related.
DR   MIM; 613080; phenotype.
DR   MedGen; C2751317.
DR   MeSH; D006061.
//
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Structured Disease Entry Format
DESCRIPTION: Standardized format for disease entries including ID, accession number (AC), abbreviated reference (AR), detailed description (DE), synonyms (SY), database references (DR), and keywords (KW).
SOURCE: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/uniprot-rest-api/blob/main/support-data-rest/src/test/resources/sample-humdisease.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
ID   46,XY sex reversal 1.
AC   DI-01682
AR   SRXY1.
DE   A condition characterized by male-to-female sex reversal in the
DE   presence of a normal 46,XY karyotype.
SY   46,XY gonadal dysgenesis complete SRY-related.
DR   MIM; 400044; phenotype.
KW   KW-0887:Epilepsy.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Metabolic Pathway Classification Listing
DESCRIPTION: Structured hierarchical listing of metabolic pathways with unique numerical identifiers. Each entry follows the format of [ID] [Pathway Description] with optional [regulation] tag and step indicators for multi-step processes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ebi-uniprot/uniprot-rest-api/blob/main/common-rest/src/test/resources/unipathway.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
698.946.R Organic acid metabolism; propanoate degradation [regulation]
698.205 Organic acid metabolism; propanoate metabolism
698.205.R Organic acid metabolism; propanoate metabolism [regulation]
521 Organosulfur biosynthesis
521.12 Organosulfur biosynthesis; taurine biosynthesis
...
```
